value.title: Setting default values using COALESCE in DAX
value.excerpt: Learn how to get default values using the DAX COALESCE function instead of IF statements. A great way to avoid BLANK in Power BI!  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/dax/coalesce-function-dax  SQLBI.com article:  https://sql.bi/659297   📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************

value.title: Using DAX to format a list of values in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Alberto Ferrari joins Patrick to walk through how you can use DAX to format a list of values within Power BI Desktop. This takes the concatenate values quick measure to the next level.  Original Quick Measure video - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SjSKCZtiNlI  Alberto's article - https://www.sqlbi.com/blog/alberto/2018/12/20/displaying-a-list-of-selected-months/

value.title: Power BI DAX Measures: Understanding Filter Context using SUMX Example (I.C.A.N. Rule) Part 1 of 2
value.excerpt: For Power BI DAX Measures, one of the hardest concepts to grasp is the Filter Context. Or is it? I explain the “Filter Context” with the 4-easy-step approach of the I.C.A.N. Rule; using a SUMX Example. I. Incoming Filters C. CALCULATE does it’s Magic! A. Apply relationships (filters flow Across relationships)

value.title: PowerBI.Tips - Tutorial - Model Performance Tuning in DAX Studio - By Marco Russo

You will not want to miss this event as Marco is a wealth of knowledge for all things Data Modeling!  Watch the Full Tutorial

value.title: Find Lost Customers Using Power BI and DAX
value.excerpt: In this video, you will learn how to use Power BI and DAX to find lost customers and new customers easily. If you want to see step by step blog post details, read it here: 'http://radacad.com/lost-customers-dax-calculation-for-power-bi

value.title: Get the Day of the Week Name and Number in Power BI Using DAX
value.excerpt: If you don't have a date table with a column that represents the day of the week name (Saturday, Sunday, Monday etc) or number (from zero to six, or from one to seven), and you just have a date field, which you want to quickly get the day name of the week, here is a quick trick for you. Read my blog
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/hJJnyr1qxtk" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Relationship Based on Multiple Fields in Power BI Using TREATAS DAX Function
value.excerpt: TreatAs is helpful for filtering, and it doesn't filter only based on one column, it can filter based on as many as columns you want. One of the challenges in Power BI relationships is creating a relationship based on multiple fields, I have previously explained a method you can use to create a compound

value.title: Using USERELATIONSHIP in DAX
value.excerpt: This video shows how to use the USERELATIONSHIP function in DAX to change the active relationship in a CALCULATE function. Article and download: https://sql.bi/664175

value.title: Year-to-date filtering weekdays in DAX
value.excerpt: Time intelligence functions oftentimes hide an automatic ALL statement meant to make time intelligence calculations easier. This video describes this behavior and what to do in case it ends up breaking your calculation. Article and download: https://sql.bi/123591

value.title: Write DAX formulas for Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to write DAX formulas to create calculated tables, calculated columns, and measures, which are different types of model calculations. Additionally, you'll learn how to write and format DAX formulas, which consist of expressions that use functions, operators, references to model objects, constants, and variables.

value.title: #4 DAX Fridays! 101: What is Context transition in DAX?
value.excerpt: You  heard it before right? Context transition, but what is it? In this video I explains the basics, and .... it is easier that what you think!! Yey!!  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center  SUBSCRIBE to learn more about Power and Excel BI! https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCJ7UhloHSA4wAqPzyi6TOkw?sub_confirmation=1

value.title: Connect to a power bi model in the service using DAX Studio
value.excerpt: You asked me to make a video when it was possible to connect power bi service to DAX Studio, so here it is :)  Two big "but"... 1. It works only with Power BI Premium 2. Read-only for now.  And here is the URL to connect: powerbi://api.powerbi.com/v1.0/myorg/workspacename  How about you let us know how

value.title: DAX Fridays! #11: Using variables in DAX
value.excerpt: Variables are an extremely useful feature in DAX, but perhaps not a well known one. Variables, 1. Make your formulas more readable 2. You can reuse them through your report 3. Can also be tables 4. Are more efficient  Download our Growth dashboard if you want to see the example live:http://curbal.com/blog/the-ultimate-dashboard-to-track-your-website-growth-with-google-analytics-and-power-bi-supercharged-excel

value.title: DAX Fridays! #112: Remove blanks from hierarchies with ISINSCOPE
value.excerpt: In today's video I am going to show you how you can remove blanks from hierarchies using the DAX Function ISINSCOPE.  I have covered ISINSCOPE before with a more difficult example, so I hope this video will explain it in easier terms and with a useful example.  Link to the previous ISINSCOPE video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sSUCyps_1O4

value.title: DAX Fridays! #23: ISFILTERED
